greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Carryless base-2 product (A048720) of run lengths in binary representation of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10922
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
example: For n=56, A007088(56) = "111000" in binary, we do carryless multiplication (in base-2) of 3 and 3, thus a(56) = A048720(3,3) = 5.
program: (Scheme) (define (A284579 n) (reduce A048720bi 1 (binexp->runcount1list n))) ;; Where A048720bi is a two-argument function implementing carryless binary product, A048720. For binexp->runcount1list see A167489.
xref: Differs from A167489 for the first time at n=56, where a(56) = 5, while A167489(56) = 9.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 14 2017
